_header: Sith fortune hath me set thus in this wise
_description: Verses expressing desire to serve his mistress — four lines, possibly monorhyming

CULFf16.Transcription:
Sith fortune hath me set thus in this wyseToo loue yow best callyd be
                        [ ]you to serue and trwly pleseas my desyre and hertus
                    esse
CULFf16.Note: End of second line crossed out.
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.
